name: Gulfstream II Jet
description: A private Gulfstream II jet, one of the most expensive items ever sold on eBay.

name: Lunch with Warren Buffett
description: A charity auction for a lunch with billionaire investor Warren Buffett.

name: Leonardo da Vinci's Codex Leicester
description: A 72-page manuscript by Leonardo da Vinci, purchased by Bill Gates.

name: The Town of Bridgeville, California
description: An entire town in California was auctioned off on eBay.

name: The 'Shoeless' Joe Jackson Baseball Bat
description: A baseball bat used by Shoeless Joe Jackson, known as 'Black Betsy.'

name: Ian Usher's Life
description: A man sold his entire life, including his house, job, and friends, on eBay.

name: Action Comics No. 1
description: A rare comic book featuring the first appearance of Superman.

name: Honus Wagner Baseball Card
description: A T206 Honus Wagner baseball card, one of the most valuable sports cards ever.

name: The Town of Albert, Texas
description: Another small town sold on eBay, located in Texas.

name: Gigayacht
description: A 405-foot luxury yacht sold on eBay, the most expensive item ever listed.

name: Original Hollywood Sign
description: The original Hollywood sign letters, sold in an online auction.

name: Britney Spears' Chewed Gum
description: A piece of chewing gum spat out by Britney Spears, sold on eBay.

name: The Domain 'business.com'
description: The domain name 'business.com,' sold in a private sale.

name: William Shatner's Kidney Stone
description: A kidney stone passed by actor William Shatner, sold to benefit charity.

name: Elvis Presley's Hair
description: A lock of hair from Elvis Presley, sold in an online auction.

name: Banksy's 'Girl with Balloon'
description: A famous painting by Banksy that self-destructed after being sold.

name: A Grilled Cheese Sandwich with Virgin Mary Image
description: A grilled cheese sandwich bearing an image resembling the Virgin Mary.

name: Albert Einstein's 'God Letter'
description: A letter written by Albert Einstein discussing his views on God and religion.

name: James Bond's Aston Martin DB5
description: The Aston Martin DB5 used in the James Bond film 'Goldfinger.'

name: Napoleon's Hat
description: One of Napoleon Bonaparte's bicorne hats, sold at auction.

name: J.K. Rowling's Chair
description: A chair used by J.K. Rowling while writing the first two Harry Potter books.

name: Andy Warhol's 'Silver Car Crash (Double Disaster)'
description: A painting by Andy Warhol, one of the most expensive works of art sold at auction.

name: Michael Jackson's Thriller Jacket
description: The red and black jacket worn by Michael Jackson in the 'Thriller' music video.

name: Pope Francis' Harley-Davidson
description: A Harley-Davidson motorcycle once owned by Pope Francis.
